pkgmetadata.longdescription: Noisy Stochastic Block Mode: Graph Inference by Multiple Testing // Variational Expectation-Maximization algorithm to fit the noisy stochastic block model to an observed dense graph and to perform a node clustering. Moreover, a graph inference procedure to recover the underlying binary graph. This procedure comes with a control of the false discovery rate. The method is described in the article "Powerful graph inference with false discovery rate control" by T. Rebafka, E. Roquain, F. Villers (2020) arXiv:1907.10176.
